title: AP support items suck really hard
body:
{{item:3504}} {{item:3023}} and recently, the still never purchased {{item:3050}}  Are all we have

Only one of them has over 50 AP attached to it, but the implication that a AP support is going to buy these items to increase their utility with their pathetic ratios on those utility spells is stupid
We can't do anything with these items to benefit ourselves, everything about these items is to improve your ADC, a good idea but it is eating away at the tiny itemization pool we have 
No one plays supports who need their utility to scale with AP, because they are terrible lategame, they never have enough AP to do anything with their ratios and are usually much much squisher then the rest of the options in the game, once the 40 minute mark rolls around you may as well be playing 4v5

All these items need their AP values hiked up to between 60-100, and usher in a few more AP support items with decent AP and perhaps an some different active other then "attach yourself and depend on this stranger to do everything for you" and we could be golden

replies.body:
Cause any support with Decent Ratios is already a mid laner. 

But theirs a lot of problems with just putting AP on support items. For starters, The more AP you have, the more gold you need to purchase it. And Supports are already working with very little gold as it is. And if they did have the AP, more along the line of other items, It would be picked up by midlaners. (specifically the utility mid laners like Lulu) 

But then again, Why would a support need utilities like that if their built in utility scaled so well with AP? Wouldn't they just Built AP items? I usually buy Morello's as my primary mana item. That's a good 80 AP right there.

I've been curious about what would happen if they tried reducing AP support damage AP scaling but increasing their utility scaling, not on shields though. Early game in solo lanes may be a nightmare but they'd lack the ability to contribute significant damage. I'm sure there's a good reason but idk.

Another option is to give some kind of steep diminishing return on their utility scaling. Some AP would be really useful but when you get an amount that would be unrealistic for a support it starts to fall off hard and becomes extremely inefficient to invest in more AP.

Just my thoughts, don't know if it would be practical or healthy for the game.

They first tried that with Lulu, and that put her in a solo lane. The only way that would work is if the support in question had a completely abysmal kit for laning. Only a hand full of champion could do that. (maybe Sona and Soraka.) But if a support had any wave clear at all. They could take the solo lane, get solo lane gold, Build AP, and have more utility than their support Counterpart. Prior to the Zillian Rework the different between support ult and mid ult, was Barely saving your life, and 0-100. 

The real problem is that Supports can't afford much. So the Better option would be to make them less reliant on Scaling all together.

Oh I remember the terror Lulu was. However, Glitterlance had/has decent base damage and I believe a .5 ratio. Why not try to cut that ratio to like .2? Of course some supports should be forced to stay in the support role. Remember jungle or top lane Alistar? Oh and solo lane soraka...no thanks.

But what about diminishing returns, kind of like with resistances? X supports heal/shield increases by 70 when they have 100 AP, at 200 AP it only gives 110 (number just for an example of course). The little AP they get from their support items would be useful but going into a solo lane would be less desirable because you'll be dumping gold onto a champ that won't scale as effectively.

That's mostly a non factor since supports can't really afford copious amounts of AP. Unless your talking about Baring supports from the mid lane, but that's kind of a lazy way to approach that.

If Any champ started showing up in a different position. Sometimes becoming OP or Oppressive. When that happens, Riot obviously has to look at the WHY. And Decide whether it's something worth supporting. If it's OP, but worth supporting, Riot will try to balance them around the new position. (and try to retain strengths of their former position) But we still have to accept the fact that Mid lane Lulu will have stronger utility than Support Lulu. If it's not worth supporting, then they gut the champion.

Riot does not want to have too much say about where champions should go. (thou does have opinion on where some champs shouldn't go) They still have to balance around the most OP build. Yet some of the best Flex picks that can do well in more lanes, do so by taking on a different role, which may involve different build paths. (Ekko had like 3 different build paths in the LCS. One for each position he was used) The best flex champions can fill multiple roles, regardless of which one he's balanced for.

Unfortunately in the case of Lulu, the changes they made to Lulu to balance her around solo lanes made her a much weaker support. 

I still think diminishing returns may be a useful way to help certain AP supports considering their low budget. Maybe not Lulu, but sona does have the problem of just being useful for the stun late game. I could go on a rant about this point because this is the same thing as Annie, but she's actually used...

OK after all this thinking I realize why Riot has had such a hard time on this subject.

I think the problem with diminishing returns on supports is that it would ultimately define that "this champion is meant to support and nothing else". Now most people would go "every champion is made for a specific role" and while somewhat true, Riot tries to never force a character in a role.

Take many ADCs for example, that have multiple AP scalings that are useless to them unless they leave their ADC role aside and go AP. Some can pull it off, some not, but in the end, the option's there.

If you go to supports, and give them diminishing returns on AP and low damage, you're basically going to them and denying them the chance of ever going AP. You're forcing them down the Support role, while most champions aren't forced into one role. Ezreal can be a mage or ADC, Wukong can be a tank or a bruiser, jungle or top. Gut Lulu's base and scaling and suddenly she can't do much other than support.

Frost fang gets +5AP, +25% mana regen, and no additional GP10 when upgraded from spell thief's. Which means for a combination cost of 500, you get one fairy charm, and a Quarter of an amplifying tome. Which isn't even 300 gold worth of stats. So for this to be even worth on paper, the tribute passive, which increase from 10 to 15 bonus damage and 5-10 gold on proc, would have to be worth at least 200 gold. And yet at best, that is a max of 15 extra damage and gold, every 30 seconds. 

in comparison, Medialion gets, a fairy charm, half a rejuvenation bead. 2GP10, +10 MS speed (2/5ths of a boot), and it's passive is entirely doubled. when upgraded from coin.

Targons has, upgraded from relic shield, 2/3rds of a ruby crystal, a Rejuvination bead, And it's passive gains 10 extra health with a stronger execute, all at double the frequency.

So Frost Fang is literally the worst investment of 500 gold. If you wanted to make that better, increase the on hit damage from 15 to 20 damage. Maybe increase the AP to 15. And for Frost queen's, do the same but give a slight damage ratio on the tribute passive. 

The problem with Frost queen's is that it was originally balanced to be the high risk high reward item. But people with less than perfect CS complained about supports having Mid level gold. considering that riot has also buffed the GP10 on the "low risk item" it is becoming clear that differences in gold gen, wasn't a good way to differentiate between them. But the spell theifs line got nerfed without compensation.
Frostfang is actually pretty good to get early. It's just Queen's Claim that's really not worthwhile.

Riot has no clue how to help supports. For the proof, just look at {{item:3050}}. It's active is supposed to boost both the support and marksman into powerful fighters for a short time. The 50% crit is nice for marksmen, but supports don't itemize AD or AS so having them crit is usually a waste. So they have it also give 20% AP to help the supports out.

The problem is that an increase of 20% to 200AP is 240AP. That's certainly much more underwhelming than having the marksman crit every auto. Supports generally can't gather that much AP together to make a %increase worth it. What are they going to do, build a {{item:3504}}? {{item:3092}}? The biggest support item AP-wise is probably {{item:3023}}, and that's still only 80.

But let's ignore that glaring weakness and bring up another problem, most supports can't make good use of higher AP numbers anyway. Since if they can, they get taken to other lanes and stop being supports. Having Zeke's grant a %AP increase to supports to boost their power is like giving a %AS bonus to mages; it's not helping much.

What they _should_ of done to help supports is have the active affect utility. Buffs and debuffs cast on others by the empowered champion now last 50% longer. Heals on others are now 50% stronger. Something along those lines.

They need to make the AP items have more utility. Like the extra damage and attack speed from Ardent Censer is amazing, It's a passive that works incredibly well on Supports and It's an item that carries can't abuse. It's probably one of my favorite items in the game because when I play someone who can utilize it properly, it feels like I'm significantly helping my team more.

The problem with AP Support items is you need to make them, undesirable in the hands of mid laners. But on the flip side, supports can't actually afford AP items. And this is my point actually with Lulu, If theses support have scaling, they do better in lane.

But the problem with Tank support is that they don't actually need tank items. If they get tank items, that's a bonus, but they get so much mileage out of just their kit. And that's ultimately what should happen with AP Supports. Give them high Bases so that they don't actually need much AP. But if they do Get AP, a bonus. 

I could see room for Censor to be buffed, if it differentiated between single target and Multi man heals/shields. Cause right now, it's balanced around Sona, Alistar, Karma, and other champs who have multi man heals/shields. But their should be room to bolster it for the single target case. 

Mikale's, is made to be inefficient. I remember when it was a must buy on every support and their mother. And then Riot put an unneeded about of Mana regen and some CDR, as an excuse to jack up the price. 

Frost Queen's should have more poke damage on it's tribute passive. Though I'm actually some what fine with the active. It's only real problem is that many supports already have slows. The item itself should just do more damage. That's what poke supports want. 

Banner is the only real good support item. In fact it's so good, it's used in the LCS. Make the support build the legion passive so that your Jungler can build greedy, all while giving them a unique split push tool.

My issue with Censor is that it's really kind of a bad item except on like 1-2 champions.  Like i will admit it's amazing on Janna, but that's not because it's good it's because her shield gives such a power boost that censor becomes half decent.  Look at censor on her versus someone like Alistar or Sona.  She gives +30 magic damage on hit, and 15% attack speed bonus WHILE ALSO giving the ally +70 AD.  So now your ally is hitting for 100 more damage per shot with a AS bonus.   Sona gives the +30 magic damage on auto and the 15% attack speed bonus but that's it.  Maybe it's just me but i don't want to invest 2100 gold and an item slot into such a small bonus to an ally, when i can drop like 700 gold more and get twice the  CDR and AP (sure my ally doesn't get the AS or magic damage on hit bonus but chances are me casting abilities faster and them doing the extra 40-60 damage is making up for that)

I play support  most of the time (Mostly because I hate the waiting time for a supp in queue), and I agree with you on the FACT that support items suck for the most part; and that the dependency on your ADC usually makes you fall off the second you are by yourself. However, I also have to agree with adding more AP to those items not being the solution.

I think that the support role needs to be diversified and strengthened, and since we can't directly change champion's stats because it might have terrible effects on  other lanes, items would have to be the way to go. 

To begin with, it sucks that as the support you are ALWAYS behind in gold and XP... always! Of course, if your AD is doing great, you will both be ahead of the enemy team... but you are always still behind your ADC (And just because you are the support and your job is to help/protect the adc, it shouldn't mean you always have to be sacrificing something for it... HELL you are already sacrificing EVERYTHING for it [it = ADC].

I think the gold income from support items needs to be increased, either by giving more gold, or giving the same gold but in shorter spurs of time. I have a support rue page where i run gold quints and all that, but at the cost of always being slightly weaker early levels and that SUCKS and it's unfair!

Maybe make a support specific summoner spell (i know exhaust is the go-to, but listen here....) that when chosen, just like smite, makes a certain item at the shop available for the champ running that summoner. Then, with that particular item, we could give supports better stats so they can be AT LEAST at the same level as their ADC. 

Another problem with supports always falling behind, is also being left behind. While LoL is supposed to be a "Team Game" we all know that it is VERY rare when a team actually plays/behaves like one (unless you are a premade 5 person team ). So in my experience as support, unless I have a good friend being my ADC, as soon as i am able to get 3-4 kills under my ADC's wing, they tend to start getting cocky and doing more solo things around the map. Once they have 3 good items or so, they could not care less about what happens to the support, and as the support, since your items are all utility and suck, you spend a good deal of time running behind allies in order to get some fun out of late game.. else, you might be able to clear the weaker jungle camps while the damage dealers of your team eat up the enemy base at their own pace.

And it would have to be through Items, if they try to change the champ stats to try and help out, they will probably end up damaging great champs like they did with Zyra. She started as a mid mage, but because her stats (and CC and range) were really great, and her ability kit is extremely powerful) people started running her as support, so she got super nerfed... now she is hardly ever seen mid, and even as support... 
I love her and main her, and play her as Mid/Supp/JG, and when I ask my friend why they don't play her they all say the same... " She is way too squishy/base health is awful, her plants are TOO EASY to destroy (always compared to Heimer turrets, not only the turret do more damage, and take longer to kill, they are also easier to place in terms of CDR and Mana spent), and that she has no mobility... her base movement speed is awful, and unless you land a good root, or slowing plant near the enemy... you'll be deforested.  SO for the sake of those mid lane mages who are still decent supports, do NOT suggest that rito fix their stats.

I don't honestly know if I made any sense now that I read all I wrote, I am just ranting, I know.... but yeah. I agree that in order to be a useful team player, and also have fun playing late game as support, you have to be selfish and "Sacrifice" a couple of item slots and get whatever items you want because you deserve it! (Sorry not sorry I didn't get a mikael's and got a morello instead!)

Rant over
